page.title: 09FARMING (cont.,3rd page)
page.content: {BOWDEN FARM }CONT..was built in the 15th. century. There is a secret room in the house which runs down beside the fireplace where monks used to hide. The walls of the house are about 3 feet thick. They keep the house cool in summer and warm in winter. {SMYTHEN FARM. }165 acres. 120 acres of this is a conservation area in an area of outstanding natural beauty. 115 acres of the land is used for grazing. 40 acres for silage and 9 acres of woodland. 37 beef cattle are grazed and 500 sheep which are grazed and fed on sheep nuts. A small number of other animals are kept. Holiday visitors are accommodated in a letting cottage and camping. {SOUTH LEE FARM.}40 ACRES. 32 acres of it is steep hills. The land is used to graze beef cattle and sheep and the fields are .6 to 1 acre in size.CONp10
